sections.description: Strathmroe is design inspired by a pad of paper in the hand. Subtle Textures and Layer shadows keep the readablity very high.

The ACC is focused on stable, conservative, clean fonts. Roboto Slab is the standard serif fonts across all products at the ACC. Muli is the current successor to Open Sans, and Maven is a slightly modern font to give a small level of interests which replaces Raleway, or Lato in other products.
A beuatiful slab font that shows a complexity and texture to the fonts used in the design.

sections.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes.

modifiers.name: .texture_light
modifiers.description: Light textures is reserved for the base of a page where it can gve a soft area for text or cards to live on top of.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_medium
modifiers.description: medium texture are used for area that are hidden away.  Collapsable navs, areas, or sidebars ususaly use the medium texture.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dust
modifiers.description: Dust is the most transparent texture allowing for the color of the background to show through the most.  This is used for the painted tops of cards, or score bars.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dark
modifiers.description: This texture predominatly used on the footer. Its rich black will alway requrie reversed text and buttons to be readable.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_cross
modifiers.description: A mostly transparent cross texture used for alternating rows of content when a little extra texture is needed.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_disabled
modifiers.description: This texture is used to paint disabled buttons and ui items giving it a greyed and X'ed out appearand.

modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

sections.description: Utility Classes(UCs) are classes that control single styles allowing for quick manipulations of the appearance of the DOM. When combined with other UCs and toggled with javascripts you can create complex and new UI without the need of writing styles into the system. Examples of some UC built UIs can be found here as reciepes. Learn more about UCs in the Introduction section

Anatomy of a Utility Class Name

The breakdown of the names for UCs follow a structured patter for easy muscle memory learning.
sections.markup:
All of the Class Names follow this ordered pattern of construction.

  1. State: Hover, Focus limited usage
  2. Class Name
  3. Value
  4. Modifier of Value
  5. Modifier of Responsive Application limited usage
Example 1
Make the background color primary modified by the shading of negative 2.
background-color
_
primary
-
n2
Example 2
On this container make the padding-top equal to 1rem, the value of 4, when the screen is large.
padding-top
_
4
-
large
Example 3
Alter the background on hover to a lighter value of alert
hover
_
background-color
_
alert
-
1
  1. `hover` => the state of hover also could be `focus`
  2. `background-color` => style name
  3. `_` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  4. `primary` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  5. `-` => Modifier Divider think of this as shift value or apply value when
  6. `n2` => Modifier Values most follow a [n5 , n4, n3, n2, n1, {0 is default} , 1, 2, 3, 4, 5], or responsive [{small is defulat}, medium, large]
sections.renderMarkup:
All of the Class Names follow this ordered pattern of construction.

  1. State: Hover, Focus limited usage
  2. Class Name
  3. Value
  4. Modifier of Value
  5. Modifier of Responsive Application limited usage

  1. `hover` => the state of hover also could be `focus`
  2. `background-color` => style name
  3. `_` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  4. `primary` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  5. `-` => Modifier Divider think of this as shift value or apply value when
  6. `n2` => Modifier Values most follow a [n5 , n4, n3, n2, n1, {0 is default} , 1, 2, 3, 4, 5], or responsive [{small is defulat}, medium, large]

sections.description: Padding and Margins are the most common usage for Utility Classes. Spacing UC's are responsive and can be postfixed with -medium and with -large to have finer control on the spacing of objects.
Margin classes are mobile first with postfix modifier for '-medium' and '-large' variations for responsive sizing.

sections.description: Borders a complex utility that demands a combo UCs to acheive their effect. The three UCs that must be used in combo are 'border_X','border-width_X', and 'border-color_X'. So to make an object with single black pixel border that is solid you would have to add '.border_solid.border-width_1.border_black'
Depends on base border module in _borders.css

variables.value:
(
  small: (
    'h1': ('font-size': strip-unit( ms(5) ) * 16 ),
    'h2': ('font-size': strip-unit( ms(4) ) * 16 ),
    'h3': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(3) ) * 16 ),
    'h4': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(2) ) * 16 ),
    'h5': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(1) ) * 16 ),
    'h6': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(0) ) * 16 ),
  ),
  medium: (
    'h1': ('font-size': strip-unit( ms(5) ) * 18 ),
    'h2': ('font-size': strip-unit( ms(4) ) * 18 ),
    'h3': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(3) ) * 18 ),
    'h4': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(2) ) * 18 ),
    'h5': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(1) ) * 18 ),
    'h6': ('font-size':  strip-unit( ms(0) ) * 18 ),
  ),
)

section.description: Strathmroe is design inspired by a pad of paper in the hand. Subtle Textures and Layer shadows keep the readablity very high.

The ACC is focused on stable, conservative, clean fonts. Roboto Slab is the standard serif fonts across all products at the ACC. Muli is the current successor to Open Sans, and Maven is a slightly modern font to give a small level of interests which replaces Raleway, or Lato in other products.
A beuatiful slab font that shows a complexity and texture to the fonts used in the design.

section.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes.

modifiers.name: .texture_light
modifiers.description: Light textures is reserved for the base of a page where it can gve a soft area for text or cards to live on top of.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_medium
modifiers.description: medium texture are used for area that are hidden away.  Collapsable navs, areas, or sidebars ususaly use the medium texture.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dust
modifiers.description: Dust is the most transparent texture allowing for the color of the background to show through the most.  This is used for the painted tops of cards, or score bars.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dark
modifiers.description: This texture predominatly used on the footer. Its rich black will alway requrie reversed text and buttons to be readable.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_cross
modifiers.description: A mostly transparent cross texture used for alternating rows of content when a little extra texture is needed.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_disabled
modifiers.description: This texture is used to paint disabled buttons and ui items giving it a greyed and X'ed out appearand.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

section.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

section.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes. It is easy to apply textures using the texture utlities.

section.description: Utility Classes(UCs) are classes that control single styles allowing for quick manipulations of the appearance of the DOM. When combined with other UCs and toggled with javascripts you can create complex and new UI without the need of writing styles into the system. Examples of some UC built UIs can be found here as reciepes. Learn more about UCs in the Introduction section

Anatomy of a Utility Class Name

The breakdown of the names for UCs follow a structured patter for easy muscle memory learning.
section.markup:
All of the Class Names follow this ordered pattern of construction.

  1. State: Hover, Focus limited usage
  2. Class Name
  3. Value
  4. Modifier of Value
  5. Modifier of Responsive Application limited usage
Example 1
Make the background color primary modified by the shading of negative 2.
background-color
_
primary
-
n2
Example 2
On this container make the padding-top equal to 1rem, the value of 4, when the screen is large.
padding-top
_
4
-
large
Example 3
Alter the background on hover to a lighter value of alert
hover
_
background-color
_
alert
-
1
  1. `hover` => the state of hover also could be `focus`
  2. `background-color` => style name
  3. `_` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  4. `primary` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  5. `-` => Modifier Divider think of this as shift value or apply value when
  6. `n2` => Modifier Values most follow a [n5 , n4, n3, n2, n1, {0 is default} , 1, 2, 3, 4, 5], or responsive [{small is defulat}, medium, large]

  1. `hover` => the state of hover also could be `focus`
  2. `background-color` => style name

  4. `primary` => Concept Divider think of this as an equal mark
  5. `-` => Modifier Divider think of this as shift value or apply value when

section.description: Padding and Margins are the most common usage for Utility Classes. Spacing UC's are responsive and can be postfixed with -medium and with -large to have finer control on the spacing of objects.
Margin classes are mobile first with postfix modifier for '-medium' and '-large' variations for responsive sizing.
